intro: Allomarkgrafia plumeriiflora, commonly known as the flame tree, is a tropical plant characterized by its striking, fiery orange to red flowers. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is native to regions in South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces long, pendulous clusters of flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can grow as a tree or shrub depending on environmental conditions.
